name: How Much is That Doggy in the Window? Quiz | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Basenji.

	The Basenji is a hunting dog that originated in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. This sighthound is often referred to as the "barkless dog" because the sound it makes sounds more like a yodel. This medium-sized brown and white dog has upright ears and a short tail that curls over its back.

Weimaraner.

	The Weimaraner is a large, grey hunting dog used by German royalty to hunt large prey such as deer and wild boar. This is an athletic dog which needs exercise and lots of playtime. It is a family dog which craves human attention and does not do well when ignored or kenneled.

Poodle.

	The poodle originated as a German water dog, in spite of the fact that many people think of the poodle as being French. This is an intelligent breed that comes in a huge variety of colors and three sizes. It has a curly coat that does not shed as much as other breeds, and is one of the most popular breeds around the world.

Borzoi.

	The borzoi is also known as the Russian wolfhound and is one of the tallest breeds of dogs. This sighthound has a wavy coat that comes in almost any color. The borzoi is a quiet breed that rarely barks. They are often couch potatoes and while they might sit with you on the couch they are not as demanding of attention as other breeds. An experienced owner is recommended for this breed.

Collie.

	The collie is a herding breed that has its origins in the British Isles. There are quite a few different types of collies, all of which are intelligent, affectionate, and have a strong herding instinct. This breed does well with children and other pets, and is often easy to housetrain as they are a naturally clean dog.

Pug.

	A member of the toy group, the pug has a curly tail, short coat, and large eyes. They are a wonderful family dog and do well with children. They can be a bit lazy and are thus prone to obesity. The pug is thought to have originated in China and has been a popular breed for many years.

Beagle.

	The beagle is one of the smaller members of the hound group. It is a scent hound that was bred for tracking small prey such as rabbits. Usually tri-colored, they have short hair and soft floppy ears. They are gentle, easily trainable and make great family pets.

Harrier.

	The harrier is an energetic hunting hound that loves to go on walks in the woods and to track almost anything. When taking them out for a walk it is best to keep the tri-colored hound on a leash, as their curiosity can cause them to run after almost anything. Their short coat needs weekly brushing, but overall they do not require lots of grooming.

Greyhound.

	The greyhound is the fastest of all breeds and has long legs and a deep chest to help them. They have a short coat that comes in almost any color and have thin skin. They are a very gentle breed that rarely bark. They are a sensitive breed which can sense the mood of their owner and can adapt to almost any living arrangement.

Dachshund.

	The dachshund is a long-bodied short-legged ball of energy. Bred to hunt badgers, this breed is fearless and unaware of the fact that they are one of the smaller breeds of dogs. They have an excellent sense of scent and hearing, which enables them to seek out badgers and other burrowing animals.
